blackgram_details.description: Black gram, also known as urad bean or black lentil, is a type of pulse cultivated for its edible seeds. It is a staple ingredient in South Asian cuisine.
blackgram_details.nutritional value: Black gram is rich in protein, dietary fiber, iron, and calcium. It provides essential nutrients and is beneficial for overall health.
blackgram_details.cultivation: Black gram is primarily grown in tropical and subtropical regions with well-drained, sandy-loam soil. It requires warm temperatures and moderate rainfall.
blackgram_details.varieties: T9, Uttara, PU 31, Pant U 19, Vamban 5
blackgram_details.uses: Cooking (dal), Sprouting, Ground into flour for making breads and snacks

prerequisites.soil: Well-drained, sandy-loam soil with pH between 6.0 and 7.5
prerequisites.climate: Tropical or subtropical climate with temperatures between 25°C to 35°C and moderate rainfall
prerequisites.pollination: Black gram is self-pollinating, so pollination is not a concern for cultivation.
prerequisites.space: Sufficient spacing between plants for growth and airflow, typically 5-10 cm apart.
